title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 3593/91 of 11 December 1991 abolishing in two stages certain customs duties applicable in trade between the Community of Ten and Spain and Portugal as a result of the Mediterranean Agreements
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 3593/91  of 11 December 1991  abolishing in two stages certain customs duties applicable in trade between the Community of Ten and Spain and Portugal as a result of the Mediterranean agreements
THE  COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The customs duties laid down in the Act of Accession on the products listed in the Annex hereto and imported into the Community as constituted at 31 December 1985 from Spain and Portugal shall be:
- reduced by 50 % on 1 January 1992,
- totally abolished on 1 January 1993.
This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 January 1992. This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 11 December 1991. For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission
ANNEX
Agricultural products covered by the additional protocols to the Agreements between the European Economic Community and Mediterranean non-member countries on which customs duties will remain at 1 January 1993
